This chain of events demonstrates a clear cause-and-effect relationship between Souza's hospitality and Forjas' request for punishment.

Finally, in Chapter 21, we see the resolution of Butler's situation when Wellington negotiates his release from punishment as part of a broader agreement with the Council of Regency. This progression demonstrates how Butler's situation changed from a secret plea for help to a diplomatic negotiation at the highest levels.

This chain of events demonstrates how Butler's mistake in Tavora led to diplomatic tensions and discussions at higher levels of command.
